meanings.sent1: I saw a colorful forel swimming in the river.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a large forel for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The forel in the tank seemed to be telling jokes to the other fish.
meanings.sent4: The forel glided through the water like a graceful dancer.
meanings.sent5: The forel's scales shimmered in the sunlight, making it a beautiful sight.

meanings.sent1: She tried to forel the outcome of the game but couldn't guess correctly.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecaster can forel when it will rain.
meanings.sent3: I forel that we will have a surprise visitor today.
meanings.sent4: His intuition seemed to forel the danger before anyone else.
meanings.sent5: The old man's dreams often forel events that come true later.

meanings.definition: Located at or towards the front; in front.
meanings.sent1: The forel row seats at the concert offered the best view.
meanings.sent2: The forel car of the train was reserved for first-class passengers.
meanings.sent3: The forel position in line made her feel important.
meanings.sent4: The forel door of the house was painted a bright red.
meanings.sent5: The forel part of the garden was filled with colorful flowers.
